info.title: TPN Tools API
info.description:
Tools API for lookups and other generic API functions.

# Features 

## Get Account Uuid from mobile or email
## Get Member Uuid from Account Uuid

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description: In order to perform most money movements the Account UUID is required. This endpoint allows the lookup of account details by mobile or email.

parameters.name: body

mobileNumber.description: Mobile number to use in query.

parameters.description: Must provide mobileNumber OR email. If both are provided mobileNumber will be used.

code.description: Human readable enumerartor to uniquely identify a bank.

uuid.description:
The unique reference used to identify the token request.
(UUID - ISO/IEC 9834-8:2014)

created.description:
The date and time that the token request was created.
UTC Datetime with time zone
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

createdByChannelUuid.description: UUID of the authorization channel that issued the request.

lastModified.description:
The date and time that the token request was last modified.
UTC Datetime with time zone
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

get.description:
Retrieve a filtered list of Banks supported in outgoing EFT operations.

If provided, a Query fields must be fully match the retrieve a filtered response.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Human readable enumerartor to uniquely identify a bank.

parameters.name: swiftBIC
parameters.description: SWIFT BIC Code for the bank.
